page.title: 20Education in St. Agnes
page.content: Mithian County Primary School is situated on the main St. Agnes to Perranporth road. The building is typical of many Victorian schools. Today there are some fifty pupils, a full-time teaching headmistress and infant teacher, and two part-time assistants. Among its famous "old boys" is Bob Monkhouse, who was evacuated to Mithian during the 1939-45 war and was for a short time a pupil at the school. In recent years the school has acquired a playing field adjacent to the school yard - but it no longer has a school garden. St. Agnes County Primary School, in British Road, is larger and is a typical rural primary school. For secondary education the majority of children travel by "school bus" to the Richard Lander School in Truro.
